reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Interesting, intense historical drama
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time reading this authors work, and so happy I did. This monarchy of the white and red roses was easy to understand with the way it was written. Because everyone has to name their children "king & queen" names there is so many repeats. It seems to me that Queen's were treated as baby maker's as when they had their babies, they were given to a wet nurse and Nanny and moved to the children's House. What a tragic situation with the two young prince's in the tower, who really killed the next in line for the throne? So many books an theories on the subject, one will never know. This author brought me too tears to many times, would recommend to any historical fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I know this book is fiction but I loved the storyline. I love the lancaster,York, Tudor Era a lot. This book was really hard to put down and I read it within a couple of days. This book has it all love,intrigue, murder,mystery, and mayhem. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really got into this book and enjoyed the story but the end was too fast and too short. I wish it had drawn out to include Henry's reaction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Novel About Elizabeth of York
reviews.reviewText: WOW! This book is phenomenal! It is gripping, intriguing, full of history, emotional, and so much more! Whenever I picked up "The Last White Rose", I was whisked back in time, and went on such a journey with this story.Alison Weir is one of my absolute favorite authors, and her books are must-reads for me! In her historical fiction novels, she seamlessly blends history and fiction, brings to life historical figures in such a unique and dimensional way, and her storytelling and world-building is spectacular. From the first page to the last, I always feel immersed in the world of the book, and "The Last White Rose" is no different!This book centers around the life of Elizabeth of York, who became the first Tudor Queen. Throughout, you really feel what Elizabeth is feeling, and come to understand her relationships with those around her. She truly was such a strong and incredible woman.If you enjoy historical fiction novels, I highly recommend this book! It kept me turning the pages late into the night, and I can't wait to read what Ms. Weir writes next.Thank you so much to Random House Publishing Group-Ballantine and NetGalley for the ARC of this book, it is unputdownable! All opinions expressed in this review are my own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Interesting historical fiction novel
reviews.reviewText: This was a wonderful story - so full of interesting historical information and so well-written. I enjoyed it so much, I purchased more books by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I really like this author but I felt this book read more like a non-fiction book than a historical novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Engaging Historical Fiction
reviews.reviewText: Alison Weir is a master storyteller! In her latest, The Last White Rose, she explores the life of Elizabeth of York, the first Tudor Queen and mother to the infamous Henry VIII.Her writing is flawless and the pace of the story is even and quick. You get hooked from very early on during Elizabeth's childhood. Her father Edward faces opposition and betrayal from the inside of his court and this turmoil had to have left a lasting mark on the young princess. She navigates through trials and tribulations, as we all must in life, and ended up matriarch to a great family of rulers who has left their mark on England and the world.If you love Historical Fiction, check out this and all of Alison's fiction offerings. I love her non-fiction, also. Her books are never dry or boring and will engage you, as this one did for me, from beginning to end. If you are looking for accuracy and great research, then look no further.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Alison Weir the best royal writer!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve read many of her books, they are all amazing and this might be the best one yet. I’m sad it’s over, the story never loses steam.

reviews.reviewText: Boken är skriven ur en ett kvinnligt persektiv vilket jag tycker är ett annat sätt att se historiska fakta på.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The first page was fold and the top and bottom of the back is damaged.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Good, but not a history, more a novel based on history
reviews.reviewText: I really like Alison Weir reads, but I made a mistake as this was a novel, not an historical narrative. True it is based on history, but even Alison acknowledges there are some mad up characters. Still it is a really good read and you feel for Elizabeth for all her woes, but she does come across as a strong woman. Recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great book. My favourite part was when Frodo and Sam took the ring to mordor
